$x_1$ is a microtone (very small musical interval) of size $x_2$ in tuning system $x_3$.
rows.n: Same place structure as "togyku'e", but refers specifically to microtones. See also: {togyku'e}.

rows.d: $t_1$ is a brush/bushy vegetation of species/type $t_2$.
$x_1$=$c_1$=$t_1$ is a patch of land at $x_2$=$t_2$
$x_1$ (text) is an abbreviation/initialism/shortened text which represents/stands in for/means/expands to $x_2$ (text) in context/function $x_3$.
$xi_1$=$c_1$ is a pony of species/breed $xi_2$.
$z_1$ is a hut of/for $z_1$, small as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ shrinks/decreases in property $c_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$g_1$ causes $z_1$=$c_1$ to decrease in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$x_1$ is claustrophobic.
rows.n: Claustrophobia is a fear of small enclosed spaces. See also {noryraclyte'a}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a small zevla meaning $x_2$.
rows.n: This word uses the experimental rafsi "-zve-" for the experimental gismu "{zevla}". This word is mostly intended for {zevla} which imitate {gismu}, such as "{raunte} for "{ronte}" or hypothetical "{gro'oxe}", perhaps "{xlei'eva}", etc. The boundaries of this category are fuzzy.

rows.d: $b_1$ is a pseudonym/pronoun, replacing real name $b_2$=$c_1$ of $x_3$=$c_2$ in circumstance $x_4$=$b_3$.
$x_1$ is anonymous to $x_2$; $x_1$ lacks a name to system/person $x_2$

$ci_1$ (mass) is a nomenclature/system of names interrelated by nomenclature rules $ci_2$ among names/terms $cm_1$=$ci_3$ (set (of quoted words)), used by $cm_3$ (person(s)) with systemic functions/properties $ci_4$ (ka).
$c_1$ (si'o) is a nominal scale of units [names and/or (meta-)categories and other qualitative classifications] for measuring/observing/determining $c_2$ (state).
$s_1$ identifies $s_2$=$c_2$ by name $c_1$ used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$s_1$ is onomastics/onomatology of/about names $j_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$l_1$ is an onomasticon of names $l_2$=$c_1$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4$.
$t_1$ is a name tag/nameplate of $t_2$=$c_2$ showing text $c_1$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_2$ with user-name $c_1$ on system/application $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
rows.n: In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevla} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevla. See also {vlaturge'a}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a cmevla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$
$b_1$=$c_1$ becomes a member of group $b_2$=$c_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a set with many members; $x_1$ is a set with a great cardinality.
$cm_1$=$cu_1$ votes for $cu_2$ among choices $cu_3$ in voting group $cm_2$.
rows.n: Applies to any election, not just public ones. Cf. {turni}.

rows.d: $k_1$ is suffrage entitled to $k_2$=$cu_1$ by standard $k_3$.
rows.n: It is a civil right, {selcemkrali}. Cf. {cmicu'a}.

rows.d: $g_1$ puts together $c_1$ into group $c_2$.
$x_1$ (collection/sequence) has $x_2$ (number) members
$s_1$=$c_1$ is logged into system/application $s_2$=$c_2$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_1$ as a member of $c_2$, registration preserved in medium $x_3$=$v_4$.
$x_1$ is an eligible/potential voter in issue (list of options) $x_2$, (with $x_1$) being a voting member of group $x_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ participates in employing means/taking action $z_2$ for purpose/goal $z_3$.
$x_1$ entertains axiomatic belief that $x_2$ is the case.
$x_1$=$z2$=$j_1$ is an infrastructure built by $x_2$=$z$=$1$ out of $x_3$=$z_3$ for $x_4$=$j_2$
$x_1$ is an element of kind $x_2$ with purity $x_3$.
$x_1$ (du'u) is an axiom/doctrine/creed/postulate about subject $x_2$, foundational to system $x_3$
rows.n: $x_1$ = {krici}$_2$ = {jicmu}$_1$, $x_2$ = {krici}$_3$, $x_3$ = {jicmu}$_2$. The system may be religious, philosophical, scientific, or mathematical. Refers to any proposition assumed as true without being proved within the system itself. See {sruma}

rows.d: $d_1$=$c_1$ is a chisel for carving $d_2$=$c_2$ with blade of material $d_3$.

$x_1$ (li) is the (signed) difference between the average of all elements/data of $x_2$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list) and single number $x_3$ (li; default: infimum of $x_2$ under ordering $x_6$ if such is finite), using averaging function $x_4$ (default: arithmetic average), weights $x_5$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list with the same cardinality/length as $x_2$; default: according to notes), and inherited ordering $x_6$ (default: standard ordering on the set of reals).
rows.n: Default for $x_5$ is the same as the default for the weights of the given averaging function $x_4$, which for the arithmetic mean of a finite set is the ordered set of $|x_2|$ terms with each term equal identically to $1/|x_2|$, where "| |" represents the cardinality of its input (circumfixed). $x_6$ is defined on a superset of $x_2$ united with the singleton of $x_3$. The default for $x_6$ is {mrenspoi}. For example: If $x_2 = (1, 7)$ and all of the defaults hold, then $x_1 = avg(1,7) - min(1,7) = 4 - 1 = 3$; when all defaults hold and $x_2$ is a bounded set, $x_1$ is the difference between the arithmetic average of (or average of the uniform distribution on) $x_2$ and the infimum of $x_2$. See also: "{sigma}".

rows.d: $x_1$ makes $x_2$ vary in property $x_3$ in amount $x_4$ under conditions $x_5$
$x_1$ is the derivative of $x_2$ with respect to $x_3$.
$x_1$ feels $x_2$ (ka) about $x_3$ feeling $x_4$ (ka) about $x_5$
$co_1$=$ci_1$ hurts emotionally due to $ci_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$ is far/distant from $d_2$ in feeling $d_3$=$c_2$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ shows emotion $j_2$=$c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ to audience $j_3$.
$x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$ in feeling $x_3$.
$x_1$ emotionally believes $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
rows.n: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {krici}, {cnisenpi}

rows.d: $x_1$=$c_1$=$m_1$ feels flattered about $x_2$=$c_3$=$m_2$.
$v_1$ is an interjection/attitudinal meaning $v_2$=$c_1$ in language $v_3$.
$x_1$=$m_1$ is a therapist treating $x_2$=$m_2$=$c_1$ for $x_3$=$m_3$=$c_2$ with treatment $x_4$=$m_4$.
$x_1$=$m_1$=$c_3$ is romantic to $x_2$=$m_2$; $x_1$ is beautiful to $x_2$ because it follows or is based on some emotional ideal that may not actually reflect reality.
rows.n: Not "romantic" in the sense of "pertaining to intimate love" (={cinpamra'a}); rather, "romantic" in the sense of viewing emotions as a higher and more important quality with extraordinary properties. See also {cinmo}, {melbi}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (event/state) feels (emotionally) good / pleasant / nice to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
$r_1$ is the sense/feeling in $c_1$ of emotion $c_2$ about $c_3$.
$x_1$=$p_1$ is a question about $x_3$=$c_2$=$p_4$’s emotion, asked by $x_2$=$p_3$ to $x_3$=$c_3$=$p_4$.
$x_1$=$r_1$ (event) moves/touches $x_2$=$c_1$ (person), causing emotion $x_3$=$c_2$ about object of emotion $x_4$=$c_3$ with causation conditions $x_5$=$r_3$; $x_1$=$r_1$ (event) is moving/touching.
$s_1$ is the heart (emotional self) of $s_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ emotionally disbelieves $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
rows.n: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {senpi}, {cnikri}

rows.d: $x_1$=$ci_1$=$cu_1$ expresses emotion $x_2$=$ci_2$=$cu_2$/emotionally expresses $x_2$ for audience $x_3$=$cu_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$=$cu_4$.
$t_1$=$c_2$ is the mood experienced by $t_2$=$c_1$ about $c_3$.
$v_1$ sighs due to emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ breathing/respiring $v_2$.
$x_1$ is therapy, given to patient $x_2$ for ailment $x_3$ by therapist $x_4$
$xr_1$ offends $xr_2$=$c_1$ affecting emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ resulting in $xr_4$ (state).
$c_1$=$n_1$ is deep inside $n_2$ by standard $c_4$
rows.n: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {condi},{nenri}

rows.d: $x_1$=$p_1$ is the t(h)alweg (path following the deepest points along the course) in/of/belonging to geographical/hydrological/potential feature $x_2$=$c_1$=$t_1$ from $x_3$=$p_2$ to $x_4$=$p_3$
rows.n: "Potential" in the definition refers to the scalar field, a sense used in physics.

rows.d: $x_1$=$cf_1$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur from its natural start; (intransitive verb).
rows.n: See {co'a} {cfari}. $x_1$ starts from the very beginning. Also in the sense of 'starting anew' or 'starting from scratch'.

rows.d: $b_1$ starts to become $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) starts to express/say $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
$k_1$ plays charades/gesture-game $ci_1$=$k_2$ governed by rules $ci_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual; includes gestures) $ci_3$
rows.n: From {corci} {ciste} {kelci}. corci1 is included in ciste3. See also {cockei}

rows.d: $s_1$=$c_1$ is a deep/rumbling sound produced by $s_2$=$c_2$ from point of reference $c_3$.
rows.n: $c_3$ could also be interpreted as a particular pitch/frequency. See also: {condi}, {sance}.

rows.d: $x_2$ (entity) takes action $x_3$ (property of $x_2$) in order to $x_4$ (clause)
rows.n: Showcase of VSO-like style in Lojban. $x_1$ is undefined. See also {zuktela}, {zukte}, {rafybri}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a thingamajig / thing which the speaker can't put a predicate upon
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ be in some unspecified relation with $x_3$; $x_1$ assigns / pairs up $x_2$ and $x_3$.
$c_1$=$b_1$ is a deep-sea submarine for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$x_1$ quits/stops/aborts waiting/pausing for/until $x_2$ at state $x_3$ and starts/continues with $x_4$ (activity/process).
rows.n: The pause waiting is not completed. See {co'u}, {denpa}.

rows.d: $d_1$ is relieved from stress/discomfort $d_2$
$x_1$ (event) has ceased happening and is not expected to start again.
$j_1$ dies / ceases to live; alive according to standard $j_2$.
$g_1$ causes $c_1$ to [rest on]/[be on top of]/[lie on] $c_2$ in frame of reference $c_3$.
$g_1$=$c_1$ rides/mounts/has sexual intercourse on top of $g_2$=$c_2$, in frame of reference/gravity $c_3$.
$f_1$=$c_1$ refuses $f_2$=$c_2$ from $c_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ approves the receipt of $c_2$ from $c_3$.
$x_1$ ask each other for/request from each other $x_2$ in manner/form $x_3$
$cu_1$=$cp_1$ pleas/[expresses request] $cu_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept)  to $cu_3$=$cp_3$ via expressive medium $cu_4$.
$x_1$ complies with/accedes to request $x_2$ made by $x_3$.
$x_1$ complies with request $x_2$ from $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a gryphon/griffin/griffon.
$s_1$ is a sense-irritating plant/thistle of species $x_2$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is a hot/pungent spice causing flavor/effect $t_2$ (event/property).
$x_1$ is a scarecrow for scaring off birds $x_2$
$z_1$ is a nest of bird $z_2$=$c_1$ of genus/species/etc. $c_2$.
$b_1$=$l_1$ is/are (an) ox/oxen [cattle/beef-producer/bovine] for pulling/drafting $l_2$ by handle $l_3$ of species/breed $b_2$.
$c_1$ is a horse cab/carriage/equipage for carrying $c_2$, propelled by animal(s) $l_1$=$c_3$ by handle/at locus $l_3$.
$x_1$ is a rowing boat or sculler, carrying $x_2$, pulled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ rows or sculls on route $x_2$ with boat, rowing boat or scull $x_3$.
$l_1$=$m_1$ is a tractor pulling $l_2$.
$g_1$=$l_1$ pulls $m_1$=$l_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$ at handle/locus $l_3$.
$p_1$ is a harpsichord.
$c_1$ is a radio transceiver transmitting/receiving $c_2$ on frequency $c_3$ to/from transceiver $c_4$.
rows.n: The $x_3$ place may specify more than one frequency, for instance in cases where different frequencies are used for transmission and receipt. Cf. {veltivni}.

rows.d: $s_1$ is a front vowel sound.
$ci_1$=$cr_1$ is a heads-up display (HUD) for user $s_1$ of machine/system $s_2$ based on principle $ci_3$. It is shown/visible in front of $cr_2$, as seen from the user's viewpoint.
rows.n: A very general sense of “heads-up display” is used here; it is not limited to one single application. For example, it could be used to refer to both the heads-up display of modern aircraft as well as the heads-up display in computing and video games. Cf. {crane}, {sazycimde}.

rows.d: $k_1$=$c_1$ advances to $k_2$ from $k_3$=$c_2$ via $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$k_1$ is an anteroom of/in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$l_1$ is an initial letter in alphabet/character-set $l_2$ representing $l_3$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is/are the frontmost among set/range $t_4$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $c_3$.
rows.n: Be careful not to use this when {li'enrai} is meant.  Their meanings may overlap somewhat.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a president; $x_1$ is president of $x_2$
rows.n: Wide sense; like {jatna}, plus the "president" title. See also {ianlaua}, {gugja'a}, {kagja'a}, {presidente}

rows.d: $v_1$=$c_1$ is a front door/gateway/access between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of structure $v_4$.
$p_1$ is the front-cover picture/image/illustration showing $p_2$ made by artist $p_3$.
$c_1$=$b_1$ becomes expert at $c_2$=$b_2$ under conditions $b_3$ by standard $c_3$.
rows.n: Coined because {cilre} makes it hard to talk about just learning about a subject. Cf. {ckule}, {saske}, {ctuca}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (event) is a test/examination of $x_2$'s skill/competence in subject $x_3$
$j_1$=$c_2$ is a profession (job) of person $j_2$=$c_1$.
rows.n: Especially a job requiring a high level of skill or training. Cf. {jibri}, {gunka}, {certu}.

rows.d: $cu_1$ is a barista/is skilled at making coffee drink/product $cu_2$=$ck_1$ by process $cu_3$.
rows.n: See also espresso (={kafrspreso}), coffeehouse/coffee bar (={kafybarja}), espresso machine (={cabrspreso}).

rows.d: $x_1$ does $x_2$ in a skilled manner
$x_1$ (person) has rank/skill level $x_2$ (li) in discipline/game/activity $x_3$
$x_1$=$ce_1$=$cu_1$ expertly produces artwork $x_2$=$cu_2$ of craft/skill $x_3$=$ce_2$=$l_2$ by process $x_4$=$cu_3$ expertly produced by standard $x_5$=$ce_3$.
$x_1$ suggests/offers expert advice/protip $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ skillfully handles $j_2$=$c_2$ in event $j_3$.
$c_1$=$xa_1$ is a geek/nerd of field $c_2$=$xa_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance $x_2$.
$x_1$ is bearberry of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the science of fairies/elves/pixies [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $c_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$x_1$=$g_1$ causes $x_2$=$c_1$ to lose property $x_3$=$c_2$
rows.n: The third place of cirko is the event itself. cf. {cirko} and {gasnu}

rows.d: $x_0$: No pain, no gain. You have to work for what you want. (nullary predicate)
$x_1$ is a painkiller for locus (body part) $x_2$
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$g_1$ practices sadomasochism with $g_2$=$c_1$ with pain at locus $c_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) hurts/causes pain for $x_2$=$c_1$ at locus $x_3$=$c_2$.
$t_1$ is hot spice.
$v_1$ is a hot/spicy taste/flavor of/emitted by $v_2$.
$x_1$=$j_1$=$c_1$ is a rule permitting/allowing $x_2$=$j_2$=$c_2$ (event/state) within system/community $x_3$=$j_3$ under conditions $x_4$=$c_3$
rows.n: The use of $c_1$ there is perhaps a bit iffy; the point here is that it's non-agentive.

rows.d: $t_1$ is a situation / condition / state / position that allows / is sufficient for event $c_2$=$t_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
rows.n: As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped.  Cf. {curmi}, {tcini}, {rau}, {banzu}.

rows.d: $v_1$ is a permit allowing $c_2$ (event) under conditions $c_3$, preserved in medium $v_4$.
$x_1$ is a type theory.
$k_1$=$c_1$ is the audit committee of $k_3$.
$x_1$ is a nightjar/goatsucker/whippoorwill of genus/species $x_2$.
$c_1$ is an owl of species $c_2$.
$c_1$ is a slipper (shoe primarily for wearing at night) for wearing on [feet/hooves] $c_2$, made of material $c_3$.
$d_1$ is dew.
$m_1$ is dark of night of day $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$m_1$ is the midnight of $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$c_1$ is nocturnal/active during the nighttime $n_1$.
$x_1$ is a nightingale of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a supper composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$cin_1$ is a/are chopstick(s) for eating $cit_2$.
$d_1$ is a table knife for cutting food $d_2$=$c_2$, with blade of material $d_3$.
$x_1$ has appetite for $x_2$
$x1$=$s1$=$c2$ is a caviar made of the roe of fish species $x2$=$s2$=$f2$
$f_1$ is a table fork for eating $c_2$, having tines/prongs $f_3$ on base/support $f_4$.
rows.n: cf. {ctidakfu}, {ctitci}. Note that {forca} is specific enough in most contexts, even more so than {dakfu}, due to not being confusable with t.ex. {tamcydakfu}.

rows.d: $g_1$ feeds $c_1$ with food $c_2$.
$x1$=$k1$ is a bowl for food $x2$=$c2$=$k2$ made from material $x3$=$k3$
$sm_1$=$b_1$ is/are tablespoon(s) [item of cutlery] suitable for eating $sm_2$=$c_2$ made of material $s_3$.
$k_1$ is a dining room in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$t_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of asphalt from source $t_2$
$x_1$ is an oil lamp using petroleum-based products, illuminating $x_2$ with light $x_1$.
$v_1$ is a fuel tank.
$x_1$ is a squirrel.
rows.n: Etymology: Sciuridae, from skíouros, “squirrel”, from σκιά (skiá, “shadow”) + οὐρά (ourá, “tail”).

rows.d: $p_1$ sets up diet $p_2$ for $c_1$ consisting of food $c_2$.
$p_1$ is the digestion of food $p_2$=$c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$g_1$ digests food $p_2$=$c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$s_1$ celebrates $s_2$ with a banquet/feast.
$t_1$ is cutlery for eating $c_2$.
$x_1$ is edible to $x_2$
$d1$ is $d2$ full hectodays (hundred day unit) in duration (default is 1 hectoday) by standard $d3$
rows.n: For use with metric dating system.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a charmeleon [pokemon]
$x_1$ is a charizard [pokemon]
$x_1$ is $x_2$ centuries in duration by standard $x_3$.
$ci_1$ is an education system interrelated by administrative policies $ci_2$ among institutions $ci_3$=$ct_1$ displaying quality $ci_4$.
$cu_1$=$ct_1$ is a textbook for teaching ideas/methods $ct_3$ (du'u), by author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4$=$ct_2$ about subject(s) $ct_4$ by method $ct_5$, preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$f_1$ is a lesson by $c_1$ for teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$x_1$=$g_1$=$c_2$ works on $x_2$=$g_2$=$c_5$ for teacher $x_3$=$c_1$ to learn facts $x_4$=$c_3$ about subject $x_5$=$c_4$
$n_1$ are instructions by $c_1$ teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$x_1$=$n_1$=$c_5$ is a lecture / an event of verbal teaching by $x_2$=$t_1$=$c_1$ to audience $x_3$=$t_2$=$c_2$ about subject $x_4$=$t_3$=$c_4$ in language $x_5$=$t_4$ with facts taught $x_6$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is a class (instructional session) on topic $x_2$ taught by $x_3$ to audience $x_4$
rows.n: Refers to a single event, e.g. "I have a class at 3:30." For a  course of instruction, see {ctusfimei}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a course (series of lessons) on subject $x_2$, taught by $x_3$ to audience $x_4$
rows.n: Refers to a full course of instruction, i.e. a curriculum or series of individual lessons at an educational institution. For an individual lesson, see {ctusfi}.

rows.d: $cm_1$=$cu_1$ is a member of electorate $cm_2$, which votes/selects $cu_2$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $cu_3$.
rows.n: Gismu deep structure is "cuxna gi'e cmima"; Cf. {turni}, {cmicu'a}, {gubycu'a}, {jecta}.

rows.d: $k_1$=$c_1$ is a gaming die, with sides $k_3$=$c_3$, with side $c_2$ facing up and having dimensions $k_2$.

rows.n: In Lojban, cunrafsi are {rafsi} (bound combining forms) that derive unpredictably from {gismu} (root predicate-words). They are morphemes of the forms CCV, CVC, CVV, and CV'V (where C is a consonant, V is a vowel, and ' is the special sound /h/). Rafsi of these forms must be memorized alongside their source gismu, since they are assigned arbitrarily (within some constraints). By contrast, rafsi of the forms CCVC and CVCC are always predictable, and match up one-for-one with gismu; these may be called {jvarafsi} ('rule-rafsi'). Note also: cunrafsi are not 'irregular' in the sense of being assigned informally in a non-standard manner; they are a part of standard, official Lojban.

To refer to what is often named simply "just intonation" but instead means 5-limit just intonation, use "cuvyto'aci'e li mu". See also: {dunto'aci'e}.

rows.n: $x_3$ determines what is the axis that is being implicitly considered and what its direction is; for example, if $x_1$ is an actually-oriented circular loop then a convention $x_3$ which specifies that the line through its center which does not intersect the loop as the axis and the right-hand rule as providing the direction will determine $x_2$. $x_2$ is not a direction but any point in such a direction, so no frame of reference is necessary (the statement holds equally true in all frames of reference, even if the labels are different). See also: {farka}.

rows.n: The rafsi zi'evla-classifier for this word is experimental: {crami}.

rows.n: The term "shrimp" is imprecise in English; in Lojban, this word refers to any and only decapod, stalk-eyed, narrow-abdomenned, muscularly-betailed, slender-legged, long-whiskered crustaceans with elongated bodies, that lives in saltwater/a marine environment, and the primary mode of locomotion of which is by swimming (especially propelled by swimmerets); the word is not taxonomic.  See also: {praune}

rows.d: $x_1$ is Summer(time)/(a)estival [hot season] in the northern hemisphere and Winter(time)/hibernal/hiemal [cold season] in the southern hemisphere of year $x_2$ and for celestial body $x_3$.

$x_1$ is a value / proof of type / proposition $x_2$ under context $x_3$ in (type / logical) system $x_4$.
rows.n: Types and propositions are considered equivalent due to the Curry-Howard correspondence. Compare to mathematical notation: "$x_3 \vdash x_1 : x_2$", with $x_4$ implied by context. In proof-irrelevant work (e.g, classical logic), this is usually written "$x_3 \vdash x_2$". $x_1$ is most likely to be filled by a {li} construct, or something that potentially reduces to a mathematical expression. Quoted arguments should be dereferenced with {la'e} or similar. $x_1$ can be filled by {zi'o}, which means that the proposition is unprovable. $x_2$ can be filled by a set of which the $x_1$ value is a member. It may be convenient to interpret {lo'i} as the gadri for types. $x_3$ will be a conjunction of {du'u} sumti, each possibly containing a bridi based on {ctaipe}. $x_4$ need not be consistent. For example, almost every programming language has an inconsistent type system (by virtue of being Turing-equivalent).

rows.d: $x_1$ is a tanuki/raccoon-dog (Nyctereutes procyonoides) of subspecies/breed $x_2$

rows.n: From "Les Schtroumpfs" (French). The name was later translated into Dutch as Smurf, which was adopted in English. See also: runcible (={rarnsibe}).

rows.n: To summarize, "$x_1$ chooses $x_2$ out of set $x_3$ to do/have relationship $x_4$ (binary ka)". See also {cuxna}

rows.d: $x_1$ chooses/selects option $x_2$ (choice), but not necessarily at the exclusion of all others among the collection of all options $x_3$ (complete list or set).
rows.n: $x_3$ includes $x_2$. This is good for checkboxes or multiple-choice responses (which would constitute $x_2$ or $x_3$ depending on the sense). See also: {cuxnakei'i}.

rows.d: $x_1$ chooses/selects option $x_2$ (choice) at the exclusion of all others among the collection of all options $x_3$ (complete list or set).
rows.n: $x_3$ includes $x_2$ when fully specified. Any element/entry/term of $x_3$ which is not an $x_2$ is not chosen. If $x_2$ is a singleton, then $x_3$ forms a radio button selection or the options in a stereotypical multiple choice test. See also: {cuxnajo'e}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (condition) is the condition for an exception/'else' case of rule $x_2$ with its own rule/outcome/consequent $x_3$.
rows.n: An exemption often is the sumti-raised subject of an exception, but usage of the English word varies and it may simply be the exception itself. If the consequent of $x_2$ (which is not necessarily explicitly specified by this word) is a a strict, nonfuzzy binary by nature and the law of excluded middles is assumed, then $x_3$ is assumed to the complement thereof. See also: "{javni}", ".{ifle}", "{da'ai'a}". Emphasis here is on the condition that causes the 'else' case (rather than the complement, which is the condition of the implicit 'IF' statement); it is usually used as a practical afterthought.

rows.d: Schrödinger
rows.n: If Lojban ever comes to accept the diphthong "eu", this word should delete the .y'y that it contains so that the first syllable nucleus is this diphthong. If Lojban ever accepts the Velarde nasal eng as a distinct letter, the "ng" string in this word should be replaced by it.

rows.d: Chinese checkers
Pure Land in the traditions of Buddhism, Daoism, Bon, and other faiths.
Central Intelligence Agency
binary mathematical operator: vector norm/magnitude of vector $a$ in structure (normed vector space) $b$.
rows.n: Contextless default for $b$: Euclidean normed vector space over the reals or complexes; in relativity, without context, the default interpretation for a four-vector is the Minkowski magnitude. $b$ determines the meaning of the norm. Accompanies and clarifies "{cu'a}".

rows.d: universal famyma'o: terminates the most recently opened construct or clause.
rows.n: cu'au looks back for the most recently opened construct that has not been terminated, and emulates whatever {famyma'o} would terminate it. It can also be subscripted with {xi}, and will terminate that many times. Note that that means grammatical function is being put in a {xi} clause, so be careful when using it. Additionally, cu'au {xi} {ro} will terminate all the way up to the last sentence-starting word (.i mi klama lo zarci pe lo pendo be mi cu'au xi ro -> .i mi klama lo zarci pe lo pendo be mi cu'au-be'o-ku-ge'u-ku-vau). This will also terminate to sentences started in {lu} (will NOT emulate li'u UNLESS used multiple times), {ni'o}, and {no'i}. It will NOT emulate {le'u}. In addition to {ro}, it can be subscripted with {da'a}, which terminates to the sentence level, minus 1. In the previous example, this would just leave the {vau} remaining, and allow you to continue to add to the place structure of {klama}.

rows.d: mekso binary/unary operator:  multinomial coefficient/binomial coefficient/choose
rows.n: If unary, a list (n_1,...,n_r) must be supplied as input; the terms of the list may not be distinct; for appropriate values, output is ((n_1 +...+ n_r)!)/((n_1)! *...* (n_r)!). If binary, a single number n must be supplied for the first variable and the second variable must be a list (k_1,...,k_s); for appropriate values, the output is (n!)/((k_1 !) * ((n - k_1)!) *...* (k_s !) * ((n - k_s)!)); note that this is not exactly the typical definition, but it allows for easier immediate usage for the binomial case (where s=1).

rows.d: discursive: indicate a change in speaker; used generally in quotations.
rows.n: Considered to have {sa'a} attached to it by default. Using {sa'anai} would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

rows.d: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to ko'a; used generally in quotations.
rows.n: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

rows.n: Notes: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

rows.d:
attitudinal: 
{cu'i'a} - intentionally
{cu'i'acu'i} - unintentionally
{cu'i'anai} - against intention.
convert number to statistical odds selbri; event $x_1$ (nu) has statistical odds ($n$) of occurring (versus not occuring) under conditions $x_2$.
rows.n: Odds $n$ represent the probability of $x_1$ occurring given $x_2$ (including human assumptions about the probability/situation); odds are a ratio of probability of success ($x_1$ occurring) divided by probability of failure ($x_2$ not occurring). For wagering odds, use "{cu'oi'o}"; for the probability of $x_1$ occurring, see "{cu'o}"; use "{lau'au}" (mekso operand) in order to convert from odds to probability.

rows.d: discursive: verbosely – succinctly.
mekso operatory: prime mark append
rows.n: For ordered inputs (A, B, C), where A is a general mathematical object, B is an integer (normally nonnegative), and C is a nonnegative integer; appends B prime(s)/distinguishing marks of type C to A. Presumably objects that have the same symbol as A but different B and C values are mutual(ly) related/analogs, but are at least formally distinguishable. B and C each default to 1. In practice, tick marks are usually called prime marks (and probably will effectively/culturally have a value of C=1); other distinguishing features are employed usually once these are used, such as overbars, over-tildes/over-twiddles, dagger, asterisks, etc. For a fixed C, this operator forms a series in B for each A. The meaning is context-specific. B = 0 iff C = 0; if A in unprimed (lacks any distinguishing marks), then B = 0; thus all mathematical objects have this operator implicitly attached to them with the value of 0 for the second and third argumentsize (note that this is not the default value for these arguments when this operator is explicitly mentioned). It is possible therefore to reference both primed and unprimed objects of form A simultaneously via reference to, for example, (1±1)/2 for the value for B and/or C (employing the setting of defaulting to the value of 1 as appropriate).

rows.d: other than me
rows.n: Can include {do}. {ma'a} can be defined as "{mi} {jo'u} {do} jo'u {da'ai}"

rows.d: "da'avni" modal: except under condition ...; unless ...; excepting/exempting (condition) ... .
rows.n: See also: "{da'avni}". Use "{teda'ai'a}" for "except if/in [condition implicit], in which case ...". Can be nested via inclusion of another "da'ai'a" within the condition which is filling the sumti slot which was introduced by the higher-level instance of this word; for example: "every Gregorian year with label which is divisible by 4 unless (it is also divisible by 100 unless (it is also divisible by 400)) is a leap year", where parenthesis denote the sumti slot and the second "unless" is nested, meaning that uears which are a multiple of 400 are indeed leap years, despite being divisible by 100 as well – in this example, "unless" would be translated by this word.

rows.d: quantifier selbri: convert all but one to cardinal selbri; $x_1$ is a set with all but one members $x_2$.
quantified selbri: converts all-but-(1) to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is penultimate among $x_{2}$ by rule $x_{3}$.
quantified selbri: converts all-but-2 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is antepenult. among $x_{2}$ by rule $x_{3}$.
pro-sumti: forgetful something/memory-less da
rows.n: Functions as {da} does with respect to existential quantification. Each usage acts as though the scope of all previous usages have been closed/terminated (or that all assignments to the meaning of this word have been forgotten/erased/overridden/unassigned). Even within the same given scope, multiple usages of this word can refer to different things (with or without qualification) and are (modulo qualification) completely free in their reference sets absolutely and with respect to one another; of course, they can mean the same thing, but it is not necessary. Usage within prenexes is essentially pointless if intended to be used after the same. See also: {da'o}, {da}, {kau'a}, {kau'e}, {kau'i}, {zo'e}.
